net.varkhan.base.containers
Interface Operable<Type>

Type Parameters:
Type - the type of the objects in the container
public interface Operable<Type>

Applies an operator to a subset of the objects in a container.

Convenience object to allow applying an Operable.Operator callback over some subset of the elements of a container.

The return value of operators replaces the original value in the container

See Also:
Iterator, Iterable.iterator(), Visitable

Nested Class Summary
static interface Operable.Operator<Type,Par>
          A callback, or procedure, used by the operate(net.varkhan.base.containers.Operable.Operator).

A Visitor callback takes a single object of the type supported by the container, processes that element, and returns a new element value that replaces the original argument.
 
Method Summary
<Par> boolean
operate(Operable.Operator<Type,Par> operator)
          Iterate over each element of the container, and pass it as argument to a operator's Operable.Operator.invoke(Type, Par) method, until this method returns a negative count.
 

Method Detail

operate

<Par> boolean operate(Operable.Operator<Type,Par> operator)
Iterate over each element of the container, and pass it as argument to a operator's Operable.Operator.invoke(Type, Par) method, until this method returns a negative count.

Parameters:
operator - the operator
Returns:
true if the container was modified as a result of the operation (i.e. at least one of the return values of the operator was different from the corresponding argument)
